page.title: 02LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: Battle of Ethandune It is generally accepted by historians that Edington is where King Alfred defeated the Danes in 878AD. Following months of lost battles Alfred's army was scattered throughout the plain and the Somerset Levels while Guthrum rested his troops to the north in Chippenham .Slowly the word was passed around that Alfred would reform his army under the Great Oak (near Warminster) on a certain day and march north. Guthrum soon learned of this and marched southwards. It was a race as to who could reach the top of the plain escarpment first and thus have advantage.Alfred did and made camp to await the enemy. The Danes were eventually beaten and chased back to Chippenham where Guthrum surrendered and was baptised a Christian. {
